segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 11

segments.pli: 2. Anussativagga
segments.en: 2. Recollection

segments.pli: 13. Nandiyasutta
segments.en: 13. With Nandiya

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagantukāmo hoti.
segments.en: Now at that time the Buddha wanted to commence the rains residence at Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Assosi kho nandiyo sakko:
segments.en: Nandiya the Sakyan heard about this,

segments.pli: “bhagavā kira sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagantukāmo”ti.
Atha kho nandiyassa sakkassa etadahosi:
segments.en: and thought,

segments.pli: “yannūnāhampi sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagaccheyyaṃ.
segments.en: “Why don’t I also commence the rains residence at Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tattha kammantañceva adhiṭṭhahissāmi, bhagavantañca lacchāmi kālena kālaṃ dassanāyā”ti.
segments.en: There I can apply myself to my work and from time to time get to see the Buddha.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagacchi.
segments.en: So the Buddha commenced the rains residence in Sāvatthī,

segments.pli: Nandiyopi kho sakko sāvatthiyaṃ vassāvāsaṃ upagacchi.
segments.en: and so did Nandiya.

segments.pli: Tattha kammantañceva adhiṭṭhāsi, bhagavantañca labhi kālena kālaṃ dassanāya.
segments.en: There he applied himself to his work and from time to time got to see the Buddha.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṃ karonti:
segments.en: At that time several mendicants were making a robe for the Buddha, thinking that

segments.pli: “niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṃ pakkamissatī”ti.
segments.en: when his robe was finished and the three months of the rains residence had passed the Buddha would set out wandering.

segments.pli: Assosi kho nandiyo sakko:
segments.en: Nandiya the Sakyan heard about this.

segments.pli: “sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṃ karonti:
‘niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṃ pakkamissatī’”ti.
Atha kho nandiyo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho nandiyo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: He went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante:
segments.en: “Sir, I have heard that

segments.pli: ‘sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṃ karonti—
segments.en: several mendicants are making a robe for the Buddha, thinking that

segments.pli: niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṃ pakkamissatī’ti.
segments.en: when his robe was finished and the three months of the rains residence had passed the Buddha would set out wandering.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṃ kenassa vihārena vihātabban”ti?
segments.en: Now, we spend our life in various ways. Which of these should we practice?”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, nandiya.
segments.en: “Good, good Nandiya!

segments.pli: Etaṃ kho, nandiya, tumhākaṃ patirūpaṃ kulaputtānaṃ, yaṃ tumhe tathāgataṃ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha:
segments.en: It’s appropriate that gentlemen such as you come to me and ask:

segments.pli: ‘tesaṃ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṃ kenassa vihārena vihātabban’ti?
segments.en: ‘We spend our life in various ways. Which of these should we practice?’

segments.pli: Saddho kho, nandiya, ārādhako hoti, no assaddho;
segments.en: The faithful succeed, not the faithless.

segments.pli: sīlavā ārādhako hoti, no dussīlo;
segments.en: The ethical succeed, not the unethical.

segments.pli: āraddhavīriyo ārādhako hoti, no kusīto;
segments.en: The energetic succeed, not the lazy.

segments.pli: upaṭṭhitassati ārādhako hoti, no muṭṭhassati;
segments.en: The mindful succeed, not the unmindful.

segments.pli: samāhito ārādhako hoti, no asamāhito;
segments.en: Those with immersion succeed, not those without immersion.

segments.pli: paññavā ārādhako hoti, no duppañño.
segments.en: The wise succeed, not the witless.

segments.pli: Imesu kho te, nandiya, chasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya pañcasu dhammesu ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: When you’re grounded on these six things, go on to develop five further things.

segments.pli: Idha tvaṃ, nandiya, tathāgataṃ anussareyyāsi:
segments.en: Firstly, you should recollect the Realized One:

segments.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi, satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
segments.en: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

segments.pli: Iti kho te, nandiya, tathāgataṃ ārabbha ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: In this way you should establish mindfulness internally based on the Realized One.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ tvaṃ, nandiya, dhammaṃ anussareyyāsi:
segments.en: Furthermore, you should recollect the teaching:

segments.pli: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
segments.en: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’

segments.pli: Iti kho te, nandiya, dhammaṃ ārabbha ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: In this way you should establish mindfulness internally based on the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ tvaṃ, nandiya, kalyāṇamitte anussareyyāsi:
segments.en: Furthermore, you should recollect your good friends:

segments.pli: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
segments.en: ‘I’m fortunate, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: yassa me kalyāṇamittā anukampakā atthakāmā ovādakā anusāsakā’ti.
segments.en: to have good friends who advise and instruct me out of kindness and compassion.’

segments.pli: Iti kho te, nandiya, kalyāṇamitte ārabbha ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: In this way you should establish mindfulness internally based on good friends.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ tvaṃ, nandiya, attano cāgaṃ anussareyyāsi:
segments.en: Furthermore, you should recollect your own generosity:

segments.pli: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
segments.en: ‘I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate.

segments.pli: yohaṃ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasāmi muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato’ti.
segments.en: Among people with hearts full of the stain of stinginess I live at home rid of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’

segments.pli: Iti kho te, nandiya, cāgaṃ ārabbha ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: In this way you should establish mindfulness internally based on generosity.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ tvaṃ, nandiya, devatā anussareyyāsi:
segments.en: Furthermore, you should recollect the deities:

segments.pli: ‘yā devatā atikkammeva kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānaṃ devatānaṃ sahabyataṃ aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapannā, tā karaṇīyaṃ attano na samanupassanti katassa vā paticayaṃ’.
segments.en: ‘There are deities who, surpassing the company of deities that consume solid food, are reborn in a certain host of mind-made deities. They don’t see in themselves anything more to do, or anything that needs improvement.’

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, nandiya, bhikkhu asamayavimutto karaṇīyaṃ attano na samanupassati katassa vā paticayaṃ;
segments.en: An irreversibly freed mendicant doesn’t see in themselves anything more to do, or anything that needs improvement.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, nandiya, yā tā devatā atikkammeva kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānaṃ devatānaṃ sahabyataṃ aññataraṃ manomayaṃ kāyaṃ upapannā, tā karaṇīyaṃ attano na samanupassanti katassa vā paticayaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, Nandiya, there are deities who, surpassing the company of deities that consume solid food, are reborn in a certain host of mind-made deities. They don’t see in themselves anything more to do, or anything that needs improvement.

segments.pli: Iti kho te, nandiya, devatā ārabbha ajjhattaṃ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: In this way you should establish mindfulness internally based on the deities.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, nandiya, ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako pajahateva pāpake akusale dhamme, na upādiyati.
segments.en: A noble disciple who has these eleven qualities gives up bad, unskillful qualities and doesn’t cling to them.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, nandiya, kumbho nikkujjo vamateva udakaṃ, no vantaṃ paccāvamati;
segments.en: It’s like when a pot full of water is tipped over, so the water drains out and doesn’t go back in.

segments.pli: seyyathāpi vā pana, nandiya, sukkhe tiṇadāye aggi mutto ḍahaññeva gacchati, no daḍḍhaṃ paccudāvattati;
segments.en: Suppose there was an uncontrolled fire. It advances burning up dry woodlands and doesn’t go back over what it has burned.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, nandiya, imehi ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako pajahateva pāpake akusale dhamme, na upādiyatī”ti.
segments.en: In the same way, a noble disciple who has these eleven qualities gives up bad, unskillful qualities and doesn’t cling to them.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Nandiya the Sakiyan moves to Sāvatthī to be near the Buddha. At the end of the rains, he asks the Buddha’s advice on how to live.
